raw_text:
I'll analyze this paper and extract the structured information according to the guidelines.

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Home-based early child development intervention on child development indicators in rural Peru: a community-randomised trial",
    "matches_expected_title": "NO"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Early Child Development (ECD) intervention adapted from National Wawa Wasi programme",
    "country": "Peru",
    "region": "Cajamarca region, San Marcos province, northern highlands",
    "target_population": "Rural children aged 6-35 months"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": false,
      "cash_support_type": null,
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": null,
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": null
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["toys", "learning materials"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "providing a new set of toys and materials every 2 months | field workers encouraged early child stimulation through increased mother-child interaction, introduced stimulating toys and learning material adapted to the child's age"
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "basic habits",
      "personal and social development",
      "gross motor skills",
      "fine motor skills",
      "relationship between objects",
      "space and time",
      "communication"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "Using a nationally validated ECD evaluation instrument, all children were assessed at baseline and 12 months later for overall performance on age-specific developmental milestones which fall into 7 developmental domains",
    "study_design": "Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "In this non-blinded community-randomised trial, an ECD intervention, adapted from the Peruvian government's National Wawa Wasi ECD programme, was implemented in 25 rural Peruvian Andean communities",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": 2017,
    "study_conducted_year": "2008-2010",
    "sample_size": 534,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,

    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": false,
    "cost_mentions": null,
    "cost_evidence_citation": null
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "an ECD intervention, adapted from the Peruvian government's National Wawa Wasi ECD programme",
    "country_citation": "The study was conducted in 50 rural communities in the Cajamarca region, San Marcos province, in the northern highlands of Peru",
    "target_population_citation": "We enrolled 534 children aged 6-35 months, from 50 communities"
  }
}
```

This paper describes an early childhood development intervention that does not appear to be a graduation program. While it includes provision of assets (toys and learning materials), it does not include any cash/consumption support component. The intervention focuses on child development through mother-child interaction and stimulation rather than economic empowerment or poverty reduction typical of graduation programs.
